snippet.title: Big Mess - trailer
snippet.description:
You are four alien kids who were playing with the Earth and you caused chaos everywhere! Now go to places all around the globe with your friends, and try to fix the BIG MESS you made.

In this demo, a british grandma will ask you to tidy up her house: bring the chairs around the table! Move the couch! Clean dishes! Water flowers! But please darlings, don't mess up everything...

★★★

Big Mess is a student game made in 4 months at the CNAM-ENJMIN, Angoulême, France. The goal of the excercise was to build a vertical slice and we ended up making 9 short levels highlighting the diverse features of the game.

You can download and play our prototype on itch: https://big-mess.itch.io/game

★★★

The game was made by:

Hugo Bombail: Programmer
Thomas Chastagnol: Sound designer
Simon Giraud: Game designer
Amaury Hauler: UR/UX designer
Louis Le Gacq: Producer
Rémi Le Gallo - Le Manach: Artist
Agathe Loubière: Artist
Bálint Márk: Game designer
Jorge Nogueira: Programmer

With the help of:

Laurent Bariet: secondary composer
Damien Drouillard: assistant composer
Thomas Imbert: co-composer

We really want to thank 'L'Alpha - Angoulême' and the association 'Rives de Charente' for their precious help and their warm welcome during the public demos we organized with them.
